intro: Psychotria birkinshawiana, commonly known as the Birkinshaw's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
